com.MASTAdView
Class MASTAdLog

java.lang.Object
  com.MASTAdView.MASTAdLog

public class MASTAdLog
extends java.lang.Object

The SDK is instrumented with log() calls to record errors, warnings and server traffic for diagnostic purposes. A small buffer of log events are kept in a memory buffer, and events are also sent to the system log (accessible with the logcat interface.) When reporting problem it is helpful to capture this diagnostic information to aid with debugging and resolution.

Method Detail

setDefaultLogLevel

public static void setDefaultLogLevel(int logLevel)
Set default log level to one of the log level values defined in he MASTAdLog class (corresponding to errors, errors + warnings, or everything including server traffic.)

Parameters:
logLevel - Int log level to set as the default value (initially NONE).

setFileLog

public static void setFileLog(java.lang.String fileName)
Enable debug logging to the named file.

Parameters:
fileName - String file name, must be a full pathname to a writable file.

log

public void log(int Level,
                int Type,
                java.lang.String tag,
                java.lang.String msg)
Log a message

Parameters:
Level - Int logging level, from 0 (none) to 3 (errors, warnings and server traffic)
Type - Log Int message type, 1 (error, 2 (warning) or 3 (info)
tag - String log message tag
msg - String log message detail

public void setLogLevel(int logLevel)
Set log message level to be recorded; log events at a higher level are ignored.

logLevel - Int log level to be recorded
